name: Venetian House Aparthotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in December 2010, a little late in reviewing I know!
reviews.title: Outstanding location right on Rynek Glowny Square

reviews.text: The location was just amazing, with a 4th storey view right down on Rynek Glowny and the Christmas Markets, with snow pelting down most of the time!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Totally clean, modern and spacious apartments, and very warm which was essential as it was -10c!. Apartment had all the mod-cons including dvd stacked with dvds.
reviews.title: Central location to places of interest

reviews.text: I would highly recommend the Venetian House for a stay in Krakow..oh yes and excellent value for money)
reviews.title: Great location and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay here. The ceilings were high, the rooms were lovely, bright, and clean. The pull-out bed was surprisingly comfortable for my kids. We liked having a little kitchenette right in the room. The bathrooms were clean and very nice. I was traveling with my elderly father who doesn't do stairs well, so it was important to me that they had an elevator. Our room looked out on the square, which was a terrific view. But at night it's a little noisy. If you are a light sleeper, request a room away from the square.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location as everyone comments! Friendly service and good apartment, BUT no view despite receiving assurances.
reviews.title: no view from top floor despite written assurances

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: V11 on the top (fifth) floor with lift was a great apartment with bedroom + ensuite and separate living room with dining area and kitchenette. The bedroom area is spacious. There is a sofabed in the living room. Everything clean, spacious and stylish, although inexpensive, furnishings.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: Anyone sleeping in the living room has to come into the bedroom to use the showerroom however, so there is no privacy.
reviews.title: A Perfect way to stay in krakow

reviews.text: Also, the ensuite had a cracked handbasin - a large triangular crack that made us wonder if the bottom part of the basin was going to fall out at any time. The edges of the shower floor were also cracked. Otherwise it was a very nice bathroom which would not have disgraced a 5-star hotel - what a pity about these cracks, not really expensive to fix, after all.
reviews.title: Ideal location in Krakow

reviews.text: What we were really disappointed about was the view - rather the lack of any view. In response to our specific enquiry about the view from this apartment V11 (V12 has similar layout and view), they replied by email: the penthouse apartment's huge advantage is a nice view over the Main Market Square from the bedroom.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.text: Excellent apartment one bedroom very large with fold out couch. Kitchen and lounge dining area. Very nice staff. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Excellent base

reviews.text: We (brother and sister) stayed here for 4 nights in Apartment 11. The room was spacious and comfortable, however, the "spectacular view of main square" was very disappointing - it was a small window at eye level in the separate bedroom. The room was certainly not luxurious, but we enjoyed the space. Apartment 11 would be good for up to 4 people, but please note the bathroom must be accessed by opening the door to the separate bedroom.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Pros: Fantastic location right on Market Square, quiet, easy to walk everywhere, A/C worked perfect on the hot July days/nights, very friendly service from all staff, and great wireless internet (fast enough for Skype!)
reviews.title: The best in Krakow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Reception in only open during daytime hours and sometimes they walk away to check guests in, leaving the desk unattended. This is very inconvenient. I found our apartment floor to be quite dirty and I question whether or not housekeeping was sweeping/vacuuming daily. Also, the hotel offers washing machines for use for free, yet you have to walk through their office, past desks of those working, to use them. This is minor, as free laundry in Europe is quite a great amenity.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note: The hotel does a great job of asking you when you will be arriving and departing. We were traveling via overnight train and I checked a few weeks before our arrival to see if we could check-in early/check-out late. The hotel said our room was currently free before and after our arrival, so they would accomodate us early/late if possible. They advised us to book the room those extra nights to be sure the room was available, but I didn't want to spend the extra money when the room was already free. This was a huge mistake. When we arrived in Krakow at 6:30 AM after a miserably hot and awful overnight train ride, we found the gate to the hotel entryway locked. I called their number on my printed reservation and was informed reception didn't open until 8:30 AM. We had to sit in the square until then only to find out that our room was occupied and we couldn't check-in early, and there were no other free rooms in the hotel that we could pay for to use for showers/resting until our room was ready. There was also no availability to book an extra night on our departure day. I assume this is in part due to the high season of summer and the popularity of this hotel on TripAdvisor. If you are traveling via over night train, I would reserve that extra night at least on the day of your arrival so that you can shower and rest. Thank you though, to the receptionist that helped us, she was very friendly and professional - let us store our bags, use the office restroom and gave us vouchers for breakfast at a cafe on the corner of the square.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous!

reviews.text: This was a a pleasant surprise. At a modest cost one gets a large room and bathroom with a view of the Market. The beds are comfortable and the appartments clean and modern. A sighly unprepossessing reception - but this is irrelevant unless you want to make a grand entrance. There is a lift.
reviews.title: Good central location for tourism and business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small amount of noise, even with the glazing, from the street below; but this dies away relatively early and was not a problem for me.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Ver convenient location for tourism or business. A definite must on a budget.
reviews.title: Central, clean and spacious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room 10 it does not overlook the square and therefore very peaceful most of the time. Clean spacious light and airy. Staff extremely helpful, Well equipped kitchen; everything you need for a perfect stay to explore Krakow. On the last night there was some very noisy disturbance from another apartment in the early hours of the morning. There is an out of hours number to call which we did and the issue was resolved very quickly.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in central Krakow

reviews.text: Would stay there again
reviews.title: Perfect location & great price!

description: Venetian House Market Square Aparthotel is situated in a stunningly renovated 16th Century town house, Venetian House aparthotel offers spectacular views over Krakow's main market square from 8 of the 11 apartments. Naturally the aparthhotel is located in the heart of the city within a few steps of the first rate shopping and entertainment that Krakow has to offer - in this location you are never far away from the city's culture and attractions.
